New Records: Canada picked up their maiden win at the Men's T20 World Cup.
Canada have beaten a Test-playing nation in a T20I game, both of those wins coming against Ireland.
Key Match Events: Canada won the match by 12 runs.
Ireland failed to chase down a 138-run target and managed just 125/7 in 20 overs.
Canada's Nicholas Kirton blazed away to a 35-ball 49 and wicketkeeper Shreyas Movva chipped in with 37 in 36 deliveries.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada were looking to win their first-ever win in the Men's T20 World Cup main event.
Ireland were looking to bounce back from their previous loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Saad Bin Zafar, the captain of Canada, said that it's a proud moment for his team and credits Shreyas Movva and Nicholas Kirton for their great batting.
Paul Stirling, the captain of Ireland, said that it is a tough loss and they were slow to begin with.
Miscellaneous Highlights: HISTORY HAS BEEN MADE ONCE AGAIN IN THE 2024 MEN'S T20 WORLD CUP! On back-to-back days, two associate nations have defeated two Test-playing nations, both in Group A.
Canada have picked up their maiden win at the Men's T20 World Cup.
Others: The match was played at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
